org.zebrafish.chart
Class GoogleChart

java.lang.Object
  org.zebrafish.chart.GoogleChart
Direct Known Subclasses:
BarChart, LineChart, Map, PieChart, RadarChart, ScatterPlot, Sparkline, VennDiagram
public abstract class GoogleChart
extends java.lang.Object

The GoogleChart class is the superclass of all Google chart classes.

0.1

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

GoogleChart

public GoogleChart(int width,
                   int height)
Constructs a chart with the specified width and height. Notice: the chart size is limited. First, its width and height should be greater then zero. Then the maximum height or width is 1000 pixels, they should be less then or equals to 1000. However the largest possible area for all charts except maps is 300,000 pixels, that is, examples of maximum sizes are 1000x300, 300x1000, 600x500 and 500x600.

Parameters:
width - the width in pixels
height - the height in pixels
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given width or height is illegal
Method Detail

addFeature

public void addFeature(Feature feature)
Adds a feature into this Google Chart. Each kind of features can only be added once, that is, if you add two Title objects then only the latest one will work and the previous one will be discarded.

Parameters:
feature - the feature to be added
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given feature is null

removeFeature

public void removeFeature(Feature feature)
Removes a feature from the Google Chart.

Parameters:
feature - the feature to be removed
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given feature is null

removeFeature

public void removeFeature(java.lang.String parameterName)
Removes a feature by the specified parameter name from this Google Chart.

Parameters:
parameterName - the parameter name to be removed
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given feature class is null

toURLString

public java.lang.String toURLString()
Returns a string representation of the object. The string contains a URL indicated to Google Chart API.

Returns:
a URL string which presents this chart
